materials.raw_text: Co: 16 g, P: 12 g, Sc: 4 g, W: 4 g

sourcing.instructions:
Co (Cobalt metal powder) - Available from specialty metal suppliers or online marketplaces. 
 P (Phosphorus powder) - Obtain from chemical supply stores. 
 Sc (Scandium metal powder) - Purchase from rare earth metal suppliers. 
 W (Tungsten powder) - Can be sourced from metal or alloy suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt metal powder) - Available from specialty metal suppliers or online marketplaces.
P (Phosphorus powder) - Obtain from chemical supply stores.
Sc (Scandium metal powder) - Purchase from rare earth metal suppliers.
W (Tungsten powder) - Can be sourced from metal or alloy suppliers.
1. Measure 16 g of cobalt powder, 12 g of phosphorus powder, 4 g of scandium powder, and 4 g of tungsten powder using a precision scale.
2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer, ensuring uniform distribution of all components.
3. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-quality ceramic or graphite crucible.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure 16 g of cobalt powder, 12 g of phosphorus powder, 4 g of scandium powder, and 4 g of tungsten powder using a precision scale. 
 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer, ensuring uniform distribution of all components. 
 3. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-quality ceramic or graphite crucible.

steps: 2. Place the crucible with the mixed powders into the furnace.
3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the material.
heating.raw_text:
1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 
 2. Place the crucible with the mixed powders into the furnace. 
 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the material.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally.
2. Once the furnace is at room temperature, carefully remove the crucible with protective gear.
cooling.raw_text:
1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally. 
 2. Once the furnace is at room temperature, carefully remove the crucible with protective gear.

steps: 1. Allow the solidified material to sit for an additional 24 hours to fully cure.
2. Use a diamond grinding wheel to shape and polish the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.
3. Optionally, seal the material with a protective coating to enhance durability and finish.
post_processing.raw_text:
1. Allow the solidified material to sit for an additional 24 hours to fully cure. 
 2. Use a diamond grinding wheel to shape and polish the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 
 3. Optionally, seal the material with a protective coating to enhance durability and finish.
